source_sentence: （五〇四）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城迦蘭陀竹園。
translation: (504) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Kalandaka Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者大目揵連在耆闍崛山。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 時，釋提桓因有上妙堂觀，於夜來詣尊者大目揵連所，稽首禮足，退坐一面。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra, who had a superb view of the hall, came to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana at night, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 時，釋提桓因光明普照耆闍崛山，周匝大明。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra's light shone universally on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa, and it was a great radiance all around.

source_sentence: 爾時，釋提桓因坐已，即說偈言：「能伏於慳垢，　　大德隨時施，　是名施中賢，　　來世見殊勝。」
translation: After he sat there, Śakrodevānin spoke a verse, saying, "A person who subdues the stain of stinginess and gives readily to the great virtuous ones is known as a good man among generosity who will come to see the world as exceptional."

source_sentence: 時，大目揵連問帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana then asked Śakra, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 云何為調伏慳垢，見於殊勝，而汝說言：「『能調伏慳垢，　　大德隨時施，　　是則施中賢，　　來世見殊勝。』
translation: "How do you tame the stain of parsimony and see excellence, and you say, 'A great virtuous man who tames the stain of parsimony and gives at any time makes this a good man among generosity, who will see excellence in the next life.'?"
What is it?"

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋答言：「尊者大目揵連！
translation: Thereupon, Śakra replied, "Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 勝婆羅門大姓、勝剎利大姓、勝長者大姓、勝四王天、勝三十三天，稽首敬禮故。
translation: Venerable Brahman, Venerable Śāriputra, Venerable eldest, Venerable eldest, Venerable four kings of heaven, and Venerable Trāyastriṃśa, they bow their heads in respect.

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 我為勝婆羅門大姓、勝剎利大姓、勝長者大姓、勝四王天、勝三十三天恭敬作禮，見斯果報，故說此偈。
translation: I have honored and venerated the Venerable Brahman Mahānāma, the Venerable Śāriputra Mahānāma, the Venerable Elder Mahānāma, the Four Kings' Heaven, and the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and I've seen their rewards, so I spoke this verse.

source_sentence: 「復次，尊者大目揵連！
translation: "Furthermore, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 乃至日所周行，照於諸方，至千世界、千月千日、千須彌山王、千弗婆提舍、千欝多羅提舍、千瞿陀尼迦、千閻浮提、千四天王、千三十三天、炎摩天、兜率陀天、化樂天、他化自在天、千梵天，名為小千世界。
translation: The sun travels around and shines in all directions, reaching a thousand worlds, a thousand moons, a thousand suns, a thousand Sumeru mountain kings, a thousand Pūrvavideśas, a thousand Uttaradhis, a thousand Gautama nikās, a thousand Yamântaka, a thousand four heavenly kings, a thousand Trāyastriṃśa gods, Yama gods, Tuṣita gods, Nirmāṇarati gods, Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, and a thousand Brahmā gods, which are called the lesser chiliocosm.

source_sentence: 此小千世界中無有堂觀與毘闍延堂觀等者，毘闍延有百一樓觀，觀有七重，重有七房，房有七天后，后各七侍女。
translation: In this small chiliocosm, there's no hall-contemplation or vajra hall-contemplation, but in vajra there's a hundred and one stories of contemplation, seven stories of contemplation, seven stories of rooms, seven queens in the rooms, and seven maids of honor in each of the queens.

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 於小千世界無有如是堂觀端嚴如毘闍延者，我見是調伏慳故，有此妙果，故說斯偈。」
translation: There's no one in a small thousand world who observes the hall with such dignity as Vijayan, and I see that this is the wonderful result of disciplining stinginess, so I said this verse."

source_sentence: 大目揵連語帝釋言：「善哉！
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to Tīrṣa, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝能見此勝妙果報，而說斯偈。」
translation: You were able to see this wonderful result and speak this verse."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋聞尊者大目揵連所說，歡喜隨喜，忽然不現。
translation: When Indra heard what Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, he was delighted and rejoiced, and suddenly he didn't appear.

source_sentence: （五〇五）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城。
translation: (505) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目揵連在耆闍崛山中。
translation: At the time, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was in the Gṛdhrakūṭa mountains.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者大目揵連獨一靜處禪思，作是念：「昔有時，釋提桓因於界隔山石窟中，問世尊愛盡解脫之義，世尊為說，聞已隨喜，似欲更有所問義，我今當往問其喜意。」
translation: At the time, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was alone in a quiet place of meditation, and he thought, "Once upon a time, Śakra Devānām-Indra asked the Bhagavān about the meaning of the liberation from craving in a rock cave on a mountain separated by a boundary.

source_sentence: 作是念已，如力士屈申臂頃，於耆闍崛山沒，至三十三天，去一分陀利池不遠而住。
translation: After he thought this, Rājagṛha flexed his arm and disappeared up Gṛdhrakūṭa to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, where he stayed not far from the Pītāli Lake.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋與五百婇女遊戲浴池，有諸天女，音聲美妙。
translation: At the time, the god Śakra and his 500 daughters were playing in the bathing pool, and there were goddesses with beautiful voices.

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋遙見尊者大目揵連，語諸天女言：「莫歌。
translation: At the time, Indra saw Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana from a distance and said to the goddesses, "Don't sing!

source_sentence: 莫歌。」
translation: Don't sing!"

source_sentence: 時，諸天女即便默然，天帝釋即詣尊者大目犍連所，稽首禮足，退住一面。
translation: The goddesses then remained silent, and Śakra then went to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連問帝釋言：「汝先於界隔山中問世尊愛盡解脫義，聞已隨喜，汝意云何？
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana asked Tissadatta, "Earlier, you asked the Bhagavān about the meaning of the liberation from craving in the mountain separating the boundary, and you were delighted when you heard about it.

source_sentence: 為聞說隨喜？
translation: Why do you rejoice in what you hear?

source_sentence: 為更欲有所問，故隨喜耶？」
translation: Is it because you want to ask more questions that you like them?"

source_sentence: 天帝釋語尊者大目揵連：「我三十三天多著放逸樂，或憶先事，或時不憶。
translation: The god Indra said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "I'm one of the Trāyastriṃśa gods who's often addicted to carelessness and happiness, and sometimes I remember things from before, but sometimes I don't.

source_sentence: 世尊今在王舍城迦蘭陀竹園，尊者欲知我先界隔山中所問事者，今可往問世尊，如世尊說，汝當受持。
translation: Now, the Bhagavān is in the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park of Rājagṛha, so if you want to know about something I asked about in a mountain range in a prior realm, you can go there now and ask the Bhagavān about it, just as the Bhagavān said, and you'll accept it.

source_sentence: 然我此處有好堂觀，新成未久，可入觀看。」
translation: However, I have a nice hall here that's not long since it was built, so you can enter and look at it."

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目揵連默然受請，即與天帝釋共入堂觀。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then quietly accepted the invitation and went with Śakra into the hall to look around.

source_sentence: 彼諸天女遙見帝釋來，皆作天樂，或歌或舞。
translation: When the goddesses distantly saw him coming, they all made celestial music, singing and dancing.

source_sentence: 諸天女輩著身瓔珞莊嚴之具，出妙音聲，合於五樂，如善作樂，音聲不異。
translation: The women of the gods wore diamantine jewelry and adorned themselves with decorative implements, and they produced a wonderful sound that combined the five kinds of music, such as the skillful creation of music, and their sounds didn't differ.

source_sentence: 諸天女輩既見尊者大目揵連，悉皆慚愧，入室藏隱。
translation: When the women of the gods saw Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, they all felt ashamed and went into their rooms to hide.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋語尊者大目揵連：「觀此堂觀地好平正，其壁、柱、梁、重閣、牕牖、羅網、簾障，悉皆嚴好。」
translation: At the time, the god Indra said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Look at this hall and see how well and squarely it stands, with its walls, pillars, beams, heavy rafters, windows, mesh, and curtain barriers, all of which are well-polished."

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連語帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to Śuddhodana, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 先修善法福德因緣，成此妙果。」
translation: Cultivating the causes and conditions of good qualities and merits in the past has produced this wonderful result."

source_sentence: 如是，帝釋三自稱歎，問尊者大目揵連，尊者大目揵連亦再三答。
translation: Thus, Tishra praised himself three times and asked Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana about it, and Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana answered him three times.

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目揵連作是念：「今此帝釋極自放逸，著界神住，歎此堂觀，我當令彼心生厭離。」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then had this thought, "Now, since this Indra is so careless and attached to the spiritual abode of the world, he praises this hall as an observation, so I will cause him to become disillusioned with it."

source_sentence: 即入三昧，以神通力，以一足指撇其堂觀，悉令震動。
translation: He then entered samādhi and, with his supernormal powers, used one of his fingers to skewer his hall's contemplation, causing it all to shake.

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目揵連即沒不現。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then disappeared and didn't show up.

source_sentence: 諸天女眾見此堂觀震掉動搖，顛沛恐怖，東西馳走，白帝釋言：「此是憍尸迦大師，有此大功德力耶？」
translation: Seeing this hall view shake and shake, the goddesses were confused and frightened, and they rushed east and west, saying to Śākyamuni, "Is this the great teacher Kauśika, who has such great merit and power?"

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋語諸天女：「此非我師，是大師弟子大目揵連，梵行清淨，大德大力者。」
translation: Śakra then said to the goddesses, "This isn't my teacher; it's the great teacher's disciple Mahāmaudgalyāyana, a man of pure religious practice and great virtue and power."

source_sentence: 諸天女言：「善哉！
translation: The goddesses said, "Good!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 乃有如此梵行大德大力同學，大師德力當復如何？」
translation: How could such a great and powerful fellow student of the Brahmā practice be, and what would be the great teacher's virtuous power?"

source_sentence: （五〇六）如是我聞：一時，佛住三十三天驄色虛軟石上，去波梨耶多羅、拘毘陀羅香樹不遠夏安居，為母及三十三天說法。
translation: (506) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying atop a soft stone in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven's ricebox, not far from the fragrant trees of Bālīyatāra and Kubitāra, and he was teaching for his mother and the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者大目揵連在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園安居。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，諸四眾詣尊者大目揵連所，稽首禮足，退坐一面，白尊者大目揵連：「知世尊夏安居處不？」
translation: The four groups of people then went to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, bowed their heads at their feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Do you know where the Bhagavān lives in the summer retreat?"

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連答言：「我聞世尊在三十三天驄色虛軟石上，去波梨耶多羅、拘毘陀羅香樹不遠夏安居，為母及三十三天說法。」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana answered, "I've heard that the Bhagavān stayed at his summer retreat on a soft rock in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, not far from the fragrant trees of Bālīyatāra and Kubitāra, to preach to his mother and the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven."

source_sentence: 時，諸四眾聞尊者大目揵連所說，歡喜隨喜，各從座起，作禮而去。
translation: When the four groups of people who heard what Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, they rejoiced and followed, each rose from their seat, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 時，諸四眾過三月安居已，復詣尊者大目揵連所，稽首禮足，退坐一面。
translation: After three months of retreat, the four groups of people then went back to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, bowed their heads at their feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目揵連為諸四眾種種說法，示、教、照、喜；示、教、照、喜已，默然而住。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then taught the four crowds various lessons, showing, teaching, illuminating, and rejoicing, and after showing, teaching, illuminating, and rejoicing, he quietly waited.

source_sentence: 時，諸四眾從座而起，稽首作禮，白尊者大目揵連：「尊者大目揵連！
translation: The four crowds then rose from their seats, paid homage by prostrating themselves, and said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 當知我等不見世尊已久，眾甚虛渴欲見世尊。
translation: You should know that we haven't seen the Bhagavān for a long time, and we're all very anxious to see him.

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若不憚勞者，願為我等往詣三十三天，普為我等問訊世尊：『少病少惱，起居輕利，安樂住不？』
translation: If you don't suffer, will you send us to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and universally ask the Bhagavān for us, 'Will you be less sick and less troubled, get up and go about your life with ease, and live in comfort?'

source_sentence: 又白世尊：『閻浮提四眾願見世尊，而無神力昇三十三天禮敬世尊，三十三天自有神力來下人中，唯願世尊還閻浮提，以哀愍故。』」
translation: He also told the Bhagavān, 'The four crowds of Jambudvīpa wish to see the Bhagavān, but they lack the spiritual power to ascend to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven to venerate the Bhagavān; the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven itself has the spiritual power to descend among humans, so let's hope the Bhagavān returns to Jambudvīpa out of pity.'"

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目犍連默然而許。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then acquiesced in silence.

source_sentence: 時，諸四眾知尊者大目犍連默然許已，各從座起，作禮而去。
translation: Knowing that Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana had given his silent assent, the four groups of people each rose from their seats, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者大目犍連知四眾去已，即入三昧，如其正受，如大力士屈伸臂頃，從舍衛國沒，於三十三天驄色虛軟石上，去波梨耶多羅、拘毘陀羅香樹不遠而現。
translation: Knowing that the four groups had departed, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then entered samādhi and, like a great man who flexes and extends his arm, departed from Śrāvastī and appeared on a vacant, soft rock in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, not far from the fragrant trees of Bālīyatāra and Kubitāra.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊與三十三天眾無量眷屬圍繞說法。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was surrounded by a myriad of Trāyastriṃśa Heavenly retinue and preached.

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目犍連遙見世尊，踊躍歡喜，作是念：「今日世尊，諸天大眾圍繞說法，與閻浮提眾會不異。」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then saw the Bhagavān from a distance, rejoiced, and thought, "Today, Bhagavān, the great multitude of gods surrounding us is preaching, not unlike the congregation in Jambudvīpa."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知尊者大目犍連心之所念，語尊者大目犍連言：「大目犍連！
translation: Knowing what Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was thinking, the Bhagavān then said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 非為自力，我欲為諸天說法，彼即來集，欲令其去，彼即還去，彼隨心來，隨心去也。」
translation: It's not for my own strength; I want to preach to the gods, and they come and gather, and I want to make them leave, and they return; they come according to their minds and leave according to their minds."

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者大目犍連稽首佛足，退坐一面，白世尊言：「種種諸天大眾雲集，彼天眾中，有曾從佛世尊聞所說法，得不壞淨，身壞命終，來生於此？」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Bhagavān, "Are there among the great multitude of gods gathered here, those among whom the Bhagavān has heard the teaching, who have attained indestructible purity, whose bodies have broken up and whose lives have ended, and who have come to be born here?"

source_sentence: 佛告尊者大目犍連：「如是，如是。
translation: The Buddha told Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "So it is.

source_sentence: 此中種種諸天來雲集者，有從宿命聞法，得佛不壞淨，法、僧不壞淨，聖戒成就，身壞命終，來生於此。」
translation: The various gods here who have gathered in great numbers have heard the Dharma from a former life, attained the Buddha's indestructible purity, the Dharma and Saṃgha's indestructible purity, and the accomplishment of noble precepts, and have come here after their bodies have broken up and their lives have ended."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋見世尊與尊者大目犍連歎說，諸天眾共語已，語尊者大目犍連：「如是，如是。
translation: When the god Indra saw the Bhagavān and Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana praising them, the gods spoke together and said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "So it is.

source_sentence: 尊者大目犍連！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 此中種種眾會皆是宿命，曾聞正法，得於佛不壞淨，法、僧不壞淨，聖戒成就，身壞命終，來生於此。」
translation: These various assemblies here are all predestined, having heard the right teaching, attained the Buddha's indestructible purity, the Dharma and Saṃgha's indestructible purity, and the accomplishment of noble precepts, and were born here when their bodies broke up and their lives ended."

source_sentence: 時，有異比丘見世尊與尊者大目犍連及天帝釋語言善相述可已，語尊者大目犍連：「如是，如是。
translation: When that monk saw how well the Bhagavān spoke to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana and Indra, he said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "So it is.

source_sentence: 尊者大目犍連！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 是中種種諸天來會此者，皆是宿命曾聞正法，得於佛不壞淨，法、僧不壞淨，聖戒成就，身壞命終，而來生此。」
translation: All these gods who have come here have heard the right teaching in a previous life, attained the Buddha's indestructible purity, the Dharma and Saṃgha's indestructible purity, and the accomplishment of noble precepts, and have come here after their bodies have broken down and their lives have ended."

source_sentence: 時，有一天子從座起，整衣服，偏袒右肩，合掌白佛：「世尊！
translation: Then, a celestial got up from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right shoulder, put his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我亦成就於佛不壞淨，故來生此。」
translation: I also achieved the Buddha's indestructible purity and therefore came here for birth."

source_sentence: 復有天子言：「我得法不壞淨。」
translation: "Another god says, 'I've attained the indestructible purity of the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 有言得僧不壞淨，有言聖戒成就，故來生此。
translation: Some say they've attained the immaculate purity of the saṃgha, and some say they've achieved the noble precepts and therefore have come to be born here.

source_sentence: 如是諸天無量千數，於世尊前各自記說得須陀洹法，悉於佛前即沒不現。
translation: Countless thousands of such gods each spoke before the Bhagavān about having attained the stream entry dharma, and they all disappeared and didn't appear before the Buddha.

translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "You may return there and tell the people of Jambudvīpa, 'Seven days from now, the Bhagavān will return from the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven to the city of Jambudvīpa Saṃkāśya under the udumbara tree outside the outer gate.'"

source_sentence: 譬如力士屈伸臂頃，從三十三天沒，至閻浮提，告諸四眾：「諸人當知，世尊却後七日，從三十三天還閻浮提僧迦舍城，於外門外優曇鉢樹下。」

translation: During those seven days, the Bhagavān descended from the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven to the city of Jambudvīpa Saṃkāśya under the udumbara tree, and gods, dragons, ghosts, and even Brahmā gods all descended from there, which is then called the world-wide site of this assembly's name.

translation: Venerable Lakṣmī asked Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "This morning, I was begging for food with you on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa, and you were smiling joyfully at a place where I asked you about the reason for your smile.

translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana told Venerable Lakṣmī, "In my path, I saw a sentient being with a body like a tower, lamenting and wailing, grieving and suffering, and riding on empty space.

source_sentence: 我見是已，作是思惟：『如是眾生受如此身，而有如是憂悲大苦。』
translation: After I saw that, I thought, 'Such a sentient being is subject to such a body and has such great grief and sorrow.'

translation: The Buddha told the monks, "In a past life, that great-bodied sentient being in this city of Rājagṛha was a cow slaughterer, and because of that cow slaughter, he fell into hell for a hundred thousand years, emerged from hell with the residual sin of cow slaughter, attained such a body, and was always subject to such grief, sorrow, and suffering.

translation: As the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, you must accept it."

translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為屠羊弟子，屠羊罪故，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，今得此身，續受斯罪。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This being was a sheep-slaughterer's disciple in Rājagṛha in a past life, and because of the sin of sheep-slaughter, he fell into hell for a hundred thousand years and suffered immeasurable pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實無異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五一二）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至路中見一大身眾生，舉體無皮，形如肉段，乘虛而行。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, he saw in the road a large, bodied sentient being with a lifted body and no skin, shaped like a piece of flesh, riding on empty space.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城自墮其胎，緣斯罪故，墮地獄中已百千歲，受無量苦，以餘罪故，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This being fell into his own womb in this city of Rājagṛha in a past life, and as a result of that sin, he fell into hell for a hundred thousand years and suffered measureless pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實無異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五一三）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至尊者大目犍連於路中見一大身眾生，舉體生毛，毛如大針，針皆火然，還燒其體，痛徹骨髓。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, even the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana saw in the road a large-bodied sentient being whose body was made of hair, and the hair was like a large needle, and the needle was on fire, which burned his body back and caused pain that penetrated his marrow.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為調象士，緣斯罪故，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This being was an elephant trainer in Rājagṛha in a past life, and as a result of that sin, he fell into hell for a hundred thousand years and suffered measureless pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 如調象士，如是調馬士、調牛士、好讒人者，及諸種種苦切人者，亦復如是。
translation: Like the elephant trainer, likewise are the horse trainer, the ox trainer, the person who likes to slander people, and various other people who suffer in various ways.

source_sentence: （五一四）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至尊者大目犍連於路中見一大身眾生，舉身生毛，毛利如刀，其毛火然，還割其體，痛徹骨髓。
translation: (51:14) Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, even the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana saw in the road a large-bodied sentient being who had lifted up a hair on his body that was sharp like a sword, and that hair was on fire and cut back into his body, causing pain that penetrated the marrow of his bones.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城好樂戰諍，刀劍傷人，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This is a sentient being who, in a past life, enjoyed fighting and wrangling in this city of Rājagṛha, inflicted harm on others with swords and knives, fell into hell for a hundred thousand years, and suffered measureless pain as a result of the remaining sins in hell.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五一五）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至尊者大目犍連於路中見一大身眾生，遍身生毛，其毛似箭，皆悉火然，還燒其身，痛徹骨髓。
translation: (5:15) Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, even the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana saw in the road a large-bodied sentient being with hair all over its body that resembled arrows, which were all on fire and burned its body back, causing pain that penetrated to the marrow of its bones.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城曾為獵師，射諸禽獸，緣斯罪故，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This is a sentient being who, in a past life, was a hunter in this city of Rājagṛha and shot at animals. As a result of that sin, he was sent down to hell for a hundred thousand years and suffered measureless pain, and now he's attained this body and will continue to suffer that pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五一六）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至我於路中見一大身眾生，舉體生毛，毛如[矛*贊]矛，毛悉火然，還燒其身，痛徹骨髓。
translation: (5:16) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, even as I was walking along the road, I saw a large, bodied sentient being with its body raised like a [spear*spear], and the hair was all on fire, burning its body back down to the marrow of its bones.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為屠猪人，[矛*贊]殺群猪，緣斯罪故，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: Even so, the Buddha told the monks, "This sentient being was a pig slaughterer in this city of Rājagṛha in a past life, and he [spear*zan] killed a herd of pigs; as a result of that sin, he fell into hell for a hundred thousand years and suffered measureless pain, and for the remaining sins in hell, he now has this body and will continue to suffer that pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五一七）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城，乃至我於路中見一大身無頭眾生，兩邊生目，胸前生口，身常流血，諸蟲唼食，痛徹骨髓。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha, even as I was walking along the road, I saw a large, headless sentient being with eyes growing from both sides, a mouth growing from its chest, and a body that constantly bled and was being eaten by insects, which caused pain that penetrated the marrow of the bones.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城好斷人頭，緣斯罪故，已百千歲墮地獄中受無量苦，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This is a sentient being who, in a past life, nicely severed a person's head in this city of Rājagṛha and, as a result of that sin, was cast into hell for a hundred thousand years and subjected to measureless suffering.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 如斷人頭，捉頭亦如是。
translation: Just as cutting off a person's head, so is grasping it.

source_sentence: （五一八）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 乃至我於路中見一眾生，陰卵如瓮，坐則踞上，行則肩擔。
translation: I saw a sentient being in the road whose skin was like a pot, who sat on his haunches and walked on his shoulders.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於王舍城作鍛銅師，偽器欺人，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This is a sentient being who, in a past life, worked as a bronze smith in Rājagṛha, forging vessels to deceive people; as a result of this sin, he was subjected to measureless suffering in hell and the remaining sins of hell.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 如鍛銅師，如是斗秤欺人、村主、市監，亦復如是。
translation: Like the copper forger, thus he deceived people with his scales, and so did the village proprietor and the city superintendent.

source_sentence: （五一九）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城。
translation: (519) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 乃至路中見一眾生，以銅鐵羅網自纏其身，火常熾然，還燒其體，痛徹骨髓，乘虛而行。
translation: He saw a sentient being on the road who had wrapped himself in a metal mesh that was always blazing and burned his body back, causing pain that penetrated his bones and marrow, and was riding on empty space.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為捕魚師，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今受此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This sentient being was a fisherman in this city of Rājagṛha in a past life. As a result of this sin, he went to hell and suffered measureless pain, and for the remaining sins in hell, he's now subject to this body and will continue to suffer this kind of pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 如捕魚師，捕鳥、網兔，亦復如是。
translation: Like a fisherman who catches birds or nets rabbits, it's likewise.

source_sentence: （五二〇）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 乃至路中見一眾生，頂有鐵磨，盛火熾然，轉磨其頂，乘虛而行，受無量苦。
translation: In the road, he saw a sentient being with an iron mill on its head, blazing with fire, grinding its head, riding on empty space, and undergoing measureless suffering.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為卜占女人，轉式卜占，欺妄惑人，以求財物，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: Furthermore, the Buddha addressed the monks, "This sentient being was a fortune teller woman in this city of Rājagṛha in a past life who changed her fortune telling style, deceived people, and sought property.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五二一）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城。

source_sentence: 乃至路中見一眾生，其身獨轉，猶若旋風，乘虛而行。
translation: In the road, he saw a sentient being whose body was alone, spinning like a whirlwind, and riding on empty space.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城為卜占師，誤惑多人，以求財物，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This soul was a fortune teller in Rājagṛha in the distant past who misled many people and sought property.

source_sentence: 乃至路中見一眾生，傴身藏行，狀如恐怖，舉體被服，悉皆火然，還燒其身，乘虛而行。
translation: In the road, he saw a sentient being with a flat body that was hidden and walking around with the appearance of terror, holding up his body and clothing, which were all on fire, and burning his body back down as he rode through the sky.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此王舍城好行他婬，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This sentient being was in this city of Rājagṛha in the past, and he liked to engage in sexual misconduct with others. As a result of this sin, he went to hell and suffered measureless pain, and for the remaining sins in hell, he now has this body and will continue to suffer this kind of pain.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。

source_sentence: （五二三）如是我聞：一時，佛住波羅[木*奈]國仙人住處鹿野苑中。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Ṛṣipatana in the Deer Preserve of Bārā [Munai].

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目犍連、尊者勒叉那比丘晨朝共入波羅[木*奈]城乞食，於路中，尊者大目犍連思惟顧念，欣然微笑。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana and Venerable Lakṣmāṇa entered the city of Pārāṇasī together in the morning to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，尊者勒叉那白尊者大目犍連言：「世尊及世尊弟子欣然微笑，必有因緣，何緣尊者今日欣然微笑？」
translation: Venerable Lakṣmī said to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "There must be a reason why the Bhagavān and the Bhagavān's disciples are smiling joyfully; what is the reason why the Bhagavān is smiling joyfully today?"

source_sentence: 尊者大目犍連語尊者勒叉那：「此非時問，且乞食，還詣世尊前，當問此事。」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to Venerable Lakṣmī, "This is not the right time to ask this question; perhaps you should beg for alms and return to the Bhagavān to ask about it."

source_sentence: 時，俱入城乞食，還洗足，舉衣鉢，俱詣世尊，稽首禮足，退坐一面。
translation: They then both went into the city to solicit alms, washed their feet, lifted their bowls, and went to the Bhagavān, paid homage to his feet, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 時，尊者勒叉那問尊者大目犍連：「晨朝路中何因何緣欣然微笑？」
translation: Venerable Lakṣmī asked Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "What is the reason you smile so joyfully in the morning on the road?"

source_sentence: 尊者大目犍連語尊者勒叉那：「我於路中見一大身眾生，舉體膿壞，臭穢不淨，乘虛而行，烏、鵄、鵰、鷲、野干、餓狗隨逐擭食，啼哭號呼，我念眾生得如是身，受如是苦，一何痛哉！」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to Venerable Lakṣmī, "I was on the road when I saw a large-bodied sentient being with a disinfected body and an impure odor riding on empty space, followed by crows, eagles, eagles, wild animals, and hungry dogs who were eating and crying out, and I thought, 'What pain would it be for a sentient being to attain such a body and experience such suffering?'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「我亦見此眾生，而不說者，恐不信故。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "I've also seen this sentient being and didn't tell him about it because I was afraid I wouldn't believe him.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來所說，有不信者，是愚癡人長夜受苦。
translation: If someone doesn't believe what the Tathāgata teaches, they're a foolish person who suffers through the long night.

source_sentence: 此眾生者，過去世時，於此波羅[木*奈]城為女人賣色自活。
translation: Once upon a time, this sentient being sold sex for a woman in this city of [Mokṣala*Nāga] to earn a living.

source_sentence: 時，有比丘於迦葉佛所出家，彼女人以不清淨心請彼比丘，比丘直心受請，不解其意，女人瞋恚，以不淨水灑比丘身，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: When a monk left home with Kāśyapa Buddha, that woman invited the monk with an impure heart, and the monk accepted the invitation with a straight face and didn't understand her intentions.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

source_sentence: 佛說是經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （五二四）如是我聞：一時，佛住波羅[木*奈]國仙人住處鹿野苑中。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Ṛṣipatana in the Deer Preserve of Bārā [Munai].

source_sentence: 乃至我於路中見一大身眾生，舉體火然，乘虛而行，啼哭號呼，受諸苦痛。
translation: In the path, I saw a large-bodied sentient being with its body on fire, riding on empty space, lamenting and wailing, and experiencing pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 乃至佛告諸比丘：「此眾生者，過去世時，於此波羅[木*奈]城為自在王第一夫人，與王共宿，起瞋恚心，以然燈油灑王身上，緣斯罪故，已地獄中受無量苦，地獄餘罪，今得此身，續受斯苦。
translation: Even so, the Buddha told the monks, "This being was the first wife of the sovereign king in this city of Bālā [munay] in a past life, and when she was staying with the king, she became angry and sprinkled the king's body with burning lamp oil.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如大目犍連所見，真實不異，當受持之。」
translation: As Mahāmaudgalyāyana has seen, it's true and not different; you must accept and uphold it."

translation: Venerable Aniruddha spoke to Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, saying, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 尊者！」
translation: Venerable!"

source_sentence: 大目犍連語尊者阿那律言：「云何名為樂四念處？」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to Venerable Aniruddha, "What are the four abodes of mindfulness of pleasure?"

source_sentence: 尊者大目犍連：「若比丘身身觀念處，心緣身正念住調伏、止息、寂靜，一心增進。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana: "If a monk mindfully abides in the mindful abode of body as body, his mind is correctly mindful, composed, calm, and tranquil, and he single-mindedly advances.

source_sentence: 如是，受、心、法念處，正念住調伏、止息、寂靜，一心增進，尊者大目犍連，是名比丘樂四念處。」
translation: Thus, the mindful abode of feeling, mind, and dharmas, where right mindfulness abides calm, still, and tranquil, and single-mindedly advances, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, these are called the four abodes of mindfulness that a monk enjoys."

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目犍連即如其像三昧正受，從舍衛國松林精舍門，還至跋祇聚落失收摩羅山恐怖稠林禽獸之處。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then, having correctly experienced samādhi just as he was, went back from the gate of the Songga Grove monastery in Śrāvastī to the terrifyingly dense forest of birds and animals on Mount Lhokhimālā in the Vajradhātu village.

source_sentence: （五三六）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: (V.36) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 乃至尊者大目犍連問尊者阿那律：「云何名為四念處修習多修習？」
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana asked Venerable Aniruddha, "What is called the cultivation of the four abodes of mindfulness and the cultivation of much more?"

source_sentence: 尊者阿那律語尊者大目犍連言：「若比丘於內身起厭離想，於內身起不厭離想、厭離不厭離俱捨想，正念正知。
translation: Venerable Aniruddha told Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Suppose a monk gives rise to thoughts of disillusionment with the internal body, thoughts of non-disillusionment with the internal body, and thoughts of both disillusionment and non-disillusionment with the internal body, with correct mindfulness and correct knowledge.

source_sentence: 如內身，如是外身、內外身，內受、外受、內外受，內心、外心、內外心，內法、外法、內外法，作厭離想、不厭離想、厭離不厭離俱捨想，住正念正知。
translation: Thus, he abides in right mindfulness and right knowledge of the internal body, such external body, internal and external body, internal feelings, external feelings, internal and external feelings, internal mind, external mind, and internal and external mind, and internal and external phenomena, as well as internal and external phenomena and internal and external phenomena, when he gives rise to thoughts of disillusionment, thoughts of non-disillusionment, and thoughts of both disillusionment and non-disillusionment.

source_sentence: 如是，尊者大目犍連！
translation: Thus, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 是名四念處修習多修習。」
translation: This is called cultivating the four abodes of mindfulness and cultivating them often."

source_sentence: 時，尊者大目犍連即入三昧，從舍衛國松林精舍入三昧神通力，如力士屈伸臂頃，還到跋祇聚落失收摩羅山恐怖稠林禽獸住處。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then entered samādhi and went back to the Bhagavān colony and the terrifying thick forest where the animals lived, like a strong man flexing and extending his arm, from the Songgahārāma temple in Śrāvastī with the powers of samādhi and superknowledge.
